title: Jurgen Klopp dismisses claims Tottenham are suffering Champions League final hangover
text:

Jurgen Klopp has dismissed any notion that Tottenham are suffering from their Champions League exploits of last season.

The Liverpool boss led his side to European cup glory by beating Spurs 2-0 in June's final, with the sides now due to meet for the first time since on Sunday.

Their recent fortunes however could not be more different, with Liverpool topping the table after a nine-game unbeaten run, while Spurs have had three wins, draws and defeats.

But Klopp disagreed with suggestions the Champions League has played any part in the ongoing issues at Tottenham.

"I can say nothing about situation at Tottenham," Klopp said. "How can I compare it with ours? We never thought about it the Champions League final in Kiev. It happened, we wanted to have more of it after the Kiev experience.

(Image: Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty I)

"We knew before last season that we were one of the few teams, six, seven, eight or nine maybe, in the Champions League that could win it. We showed that the year before, and we thought we should try it.

"We didn’t suffer during the season because of the Champions League final and I don’t think Tottenham is like this. You just carry on."

Rumours of squad unrest and uncertainty behind the scenes have dogged Tottenham's start to the campaign.

They have suffered losses to Newcastle , Leicester and Brighton ; as well as Carabao Cup elimination to Colchester, and a 7-2 drubbing at the hands of Bayern Munich.

(Image: Getty Images)

But Klopp feels there is no way to determine what the issues are at the club from the outside, and is taking their 5-0 win over Red Star Belgrade in midweek at face value.

"I can’t say anything about Tottenham. You have to be in the situation to understand it, and I am not in Tottenham’s situation.

"What I saw on Tuesday was a very good Tottenham side. That’s what we are thinking about, not about why the start has not been as you or Tottenham expected."

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Spurs have provided tricky opposition for Liverpool in recent times, with a late Mohamed Salah goal proving the only difference in this fixture last season.

And following the Champions League final win in June, Klopp feels Tottenham have a point to prove at Anfield.

"We should not be surprised [at their start]," he added. "From time to time, things don’t work out. That’s football.

"We saw in that midweek game, and even in the other games they had good moments. They didn’t forget how to play football. Harry Kane, Son, Alli, they didn’t forget.

"The Eriksen situation, all that stuff, you cannot finally understand it from outside, but they are always able to put a proper performance in and that is what we have to expect.

"And on top we won the Champions League final. We were very respectful that night with all the celebrations, but we were still the ones on the other side of that night and of course that is another additional motivation.

"It’s a football game between two good football teams.

"I don’t know how many points they have but they are a top side and will be for the whole season. We have to respect that and play the best football we can play.
description: Spurs have struggled for results this season following their route to the European cup final against Liverpool in June
